Create an iwillsurvive object

iwillsurvive.Rd

Create an iwillsurvive object

Create an iwillsurvive object

iwillsurvive(
  cohort,
  followup_time = "followup_months",
  event_status = "event_status",
  patient_id = "patientid",
  terms = NULL,
  type = "right",
  fit = NULL,
  event_title = NULL,
  index_title = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  followup_time_units = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

iwillsurvive(
  cohort,
  followup_time = "followup_months",
  event_status = "event_status",
  patient_id = "patientid",
  terms = NULL,
  type = "right",
  fit = NULL,
  event_title = NULL,
  index_title = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  followup_time_units = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

cohort

dataframe. A one-row-per-patient dataframe
followup_time

character.
event_status

character.
patient_id

character.
terms

character.
type

character. See ?survival::survfit.formula
fit

survfit. An optional survfit object created from survival:survfit(). If specified, no additional model(s) will be fit.
event_title

character.
index_title

character.
title

character.
followup_time_units

character. Units used in followup time
verbose

logical. If TRUE, return messages

Value

survfit. See ?survival::survfit.object to learn more

survfit. See ?survival::survfit.object to learn more

Examples


cohort <- data.frame(
  patientid = 1:20,
  followup_months = c(
    6.1, 15.4, 22, 24.6, 25.6, 26.1, 28.7, 46.9, 54.5, 55, 62.2,
    65.5, 88.1, 108.5, 116, 119.1, 119.6, 169.1, 317.8, 381.7
  ),
  event_status = c(
    FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE,
    TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE
  ),
  group = c(
    "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b",
    "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b"
  )
)

# Ignoring group term
cohort_fit <- iwillsurvive(cohort)

#> ── iwillsurvive ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> - 13 of 20 (65%) patient(s) experienced the event.
#> - survival::survfit(survival::Surv(followup_months, event_status, type = 'right') ~ 1, data = cohort)
#> - Median Survival = 88.1

# Now including some covariates
cohort_fit <- iwillsurvive(cohort,
  terms = "group"
)

#> ── iwillsurvive ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> - 13 of 20 (65%) patient(s) experienced the event.
#> - survival::survfit(survival::Surv(followup_months, event_status, type = 'right') ~ group, data = cohort)

cohort <- data.frame(
  patientid = 1:20,
  followup_months = c(
    6.1, 15.4, 22, 24.6, 25.6, 26.1, 28.7, 46.9, 54.5, 55, 62.2,
    65.5, 88.1, 108.5, 116, 119.1, 119.6, 169.1, 317.8, 381.7
  ),
  event_status = c(
    FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE,
    TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE
  ),
  group = c(
    "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b",
    "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b", "a", "b"
  )
)

# Ignoring group term

cohort_fit <- iwillsurvive(cohort)

#> ── iwillsurvive ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> - 13 of 20 (65%) patient(s) experienced the event.
#> - survival::survfit(survival::Surv(followup_months, event_status, type = 'right') ~ 1, data = cohort)
#> - Median Survival = 88.1
cohort_fit

#> An iwillsurvive object estimating survival from <index> to <event> 
#> 
#> 20 Patients:
#> <event> = 13 (65%), Censored = 7 (35%)
#> 
#> Median Survival (months):
#> all = 88.1
#> 
#> |a............................................
#> |..a..........................................
#> |..a..........................................
#> |..a..........................................
#> |....a........................................
#> |.....a.......................................
#> |......a......................................
#> |.......a.....................................
#> |.........a...................................
#> |............a................................
#> |.............a...............................
#> |.............a...............................
#> |...................a.........................

# Now including some covariates

cohort_fit <- iwillsurvive(cohort,
  terms = "group"
)

#> ── iwillsurvive ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> - 13 of 20 (65%) patient(s) experienced the event.
#> - survival::survfit(survival::Surv(followup_months, event_status, type = 'right') ~ group, data = cohort)

cohort_fit

#> An iwillsurvive object estimating survival from <index> to <event> 
#> 
#> 20 Patients:
#> <event> = 13 (65%), Censored = 7 (35%)
#> 
#> Median Survival (months):
#> group=a = 88.1, group=b = 108.5
#> diff = 20
#> 
#> |gg...........................................
#> |.gg..........................................
#> |..*..........................................
#> |....g........................................
#> |.....g.......................................
#> |.......g.....................................
#> |......g......................................
#> |............g................................
#> |.........g...................................
#> |.............g...............................
#> |.............g.....g.........................
